00078 /* ==========================================================================
00079  *                              ANSI Terminal
00080  * ==========================================================================
00081  */
00082 
00083 #if     ANSI
00084 
00085 /*
00086  * The routines in this section provide support for ANSI style terminals
00087  * over a serial line. The serial I/O services are provided by routines in
00088  * "termio.c". It compiles into nothing if not an ANSI device.
00089  */
00090 
00091 #define NROW    23                      /* Screen size.                 */
00092 #define NCOL    77                      /* Edit if you want to.         */
00093 #define BEL     0x07                    /* BEL character.               */
00094 #define ESC     0x1B                    /* ESC character.               */
00095 
00096 /*
00097  * Standard terminal interface dispatch table. Most of the fields point into
00098  * "termio" code.
00099  */
00100 TERM    term    = {
00101         NROW-1,
00102         NCOL,
00103         ansiopen,
00104         ttclose,
00105         ttgetc,
00106         ttputc,
00107         ttflush,
00108         ansimove,
00109         ansieeol,
00110         ansieeop,
00111         ansibeep
00112 };
00113 
00114 static void ansimove(
00115 int row,
00116 int col)
00117 {
00118         ttputc(ESC);
00119         ttputc('[');
00120         ansiparm(row+1);
00121         ttputc(';');
00122         ansiparm(col+1);
00123         ttputc('H');
00124 }
00125 
00126 static void ansieeol()
00127 {
00128         ttputc(ESC);
00129         ttputc('[');
00130         ttputc('K');
00131 }
00132 
00133 static void ansieeop()
00134 {
00135         ttputc(ESC);
00136         ttputc('[');
00137         ttputc('J');
00138 }
00139 
00140 static void ansibeep()
00141 {
00142         ttputc(BEL);
00143         ttflush();
00144 }
00145 
00146 static void ansiparm(
00147 int    n)
00148 {
00149         register int    q;
00150 
00151         q = n/10;
00152         if (q != 0)
00153                 ansiparm(q);
00154         ttputc((n%10) + '0');
00155 }
00156 
00157 static void ansiopen()
00158 {
00159 #if     UNIX_7 || UNIX_V || LINUX || DARWIN
00160         register char *cp;
00161 
00162         if ((cp = getenv("TERM")) == NULL) {
00163                 puts("Shell variable TERM not defined!");
00164                 exit(1);
00165         }
00166         if (strcmp(cp, "vt100") != 0) {
00167                 puts("Terminal type not 'vt100'!");
00168                 exit(1);
00169         }
00170 #endif
00171         ttopen();
00172 }
00173 
00174 #endif

00176 /* ==========================================================================
00177  *                              VT52 Terminal
00178  * ==========================================================================
00179  */
00180 
00181 #if     VT52
00182 
00183 /*
00184  * The routines in this section
00185  * provide support for VT52 style terminals
00186  * over a serial line. The serial I/O services are
00187  * provided by routines in "termio.c". It compiles
00188  * into nothing if not a VT52 style device. The
00189  * bell on the VT52 is terrible, so the "beep"
00190  * routine is conditionalized on defining BEL.
00191  */
00192 
00193 #define NROW    24                      /* Screen size.                 */
00194 #define NCOL    80                      /* Edit if you want to.         */
00195 #define BIAS    0x20                    /* Origin 0 coordinate bias.    */
00196 #define ESC     0x1B                    /* ESC character.               */
00197 #define BEL     0x07                    /* ascii bell character         */
00198 
00199 /*
00200  * Dispatch table. All the
00201  * hard fields just point into the
00202  * terminal I/O code.
00203  */
00204 globle TERM    term    = {
00205         NROW-1,
00206         NCOL,
00207         vt52open,
00208         ttclose,
00209         ttgetc,
00210         ttputc,
00211         ttflush,
00212         vt52move,
00213         vt52eeol,
00214         vt52eeop,
00215         vt52beep
00216 };
00217 
00218 static void vt52move(
00219 int row,
00220 int col)
00221 {
00222         ttputc(ESC);
00223         ttputc('Y');
00224         ttputc(row+BIAS);
00225         ttputc(col+BIAS);
00226 }

00231         ttputc('K');
00232 }
00233

00235 {
00236         ttputc(ESC);
00237         ttputc('J');
00238 }
00239 
00240 static void vt52beep()
00241 {
00242 #ifdef  BEL
00243         ttputc(BEL);
00244         ttflush();
00245 #endif
00246 }

00248 static void vt52open()
00249 {
00250 #if     UNIX_7 || UNIX_V || LINUX || DARWIN
00251         register char *cp;
00252 
00253         if ((cp = getenv("TERM")) == NULL) {
00254                 puts("Shell variable TERM not defined!");
00255                 exit(1);
00256         }
00257         if (strcmp(cp, "vt52") != 0 && strcmp(cp, "z19") != 0) {
00258                 puts("Terminal type not 'vt52'or 'z19' !");
00259                 exit(1);
00260         }
00261 #endif
00262         ttopen();
00263 }
00264 
00265 #endif

00284 #define NROW    25                      /* Screen size. rows            */
00285 #define NCOL    80                      /* Columns                      */
00286 #define BEL     0x07                    /* BEL character.               */
00287 #define ESC     0x1B                    /* ESC character.               */
00288 #define SPACE   32
00289 
00290 #define SCADC   0xb8000000L     /* CGA address of screen RAM    */
00291 #define SCADM   0xb0000000L     /* MONO address of screen RAM   */
00292 
00293 #define MONOCRSR 0x0B0D                 /* monochrome cursor        */
00294 #define CGACRSR 0x0607                  /* CGA cursor               */
00295 
00296 #define CDCGA   0                       /* color graphics card          */
00297 #define CDMONO  1                       /* monochrome text card         */
00298 #define CDSENSE 9                       /* detect the card type         */
00299 
00300 #define NDRIVE  3                       /* number of screen drivers     */
00301 
00302 /*
00303  * Standard terminal interface dispatch table. Most of the fields point into
00304  * "termio" code.
00305  */

00308         NROW-1,
00309         NCOL,
00310         pc_open,

00314         ttflush,

00321 static int dtype = -1;          /* current display type         */
00322 
00323 static long scadd;              /* address of screen ram        */
00324 static int *scptr[NROW];        /* pointer to screen lines      */
00325 static unsigned int sline[NCOL];/* screen line image            */
00326 
00327 static union REGS rg;
00328 
00329 static void pc_open()
00330 {
00331  scinit(CDSENSE);
00332  ttopen();
00333 }
00334 
00335 static int scinit(      /* initialize the screen head pointers */
00336 
00337 int type)       /* type of adapter to init for */
00338 
00339 {
00340         union {
00341                 long laddr;     /* long form of address */
00342                 int *paddr;     /* pointer form of address */
00343         } addr;
00344         int i;
00345 
00346         /* if asked...find out what display is connected */
00347         if (type == CDSENSE)
00348                 type = getboard();
00349 
00350         /* if we have nothing to do....don't do it */
00351         if (dtype == type)
00352                 return(TRUE);
00353 
00354         switch (type) {
00355                 case CDMONO:    /* Monochrome adapter */
00356                                 scadd = SCADM;
00357                                 break;
00358 
00359                 case CDCGA:     /* Color graphics adapter */
00360                                 scadd = SCADC;
00361                                 break;
00362 
00363         }
00364         dtype = type;
00365 
00366         /* initialize the screen pointer array */
00367         for (i = 0; i < NROW; i++) {
00368                 addr.laddr = scadd + (long)(NCOL * i * 2);
00369                 scptr[i] = addr.paddr;
00370         }
00371         return(TRUE);
00372 }
00373 
00374 /* getboard:    Determine which type of display board is attached.
00375                 Current known types include:
00376 
00377                 CDMONO  Monochrome graphics adapter
00378                 CDCGA   Color Graphics Adapter
00379 */
00380 
00381 /* getbaord:    Detect the current display adapter
00382                 if MONO         set to MONO
00383                    CGA          set to CGA
00384 */
00385 
00386 static int getboard()
00387 {
00388         int type;       /* board type to return */
00389 
00390         type = CDCGA;
00391         int86(0x11, &rg, &rg);
00392         if ((((rg.x.ax >> 4) & 3) == 3))
00393                 type = CDMONO;
00394         return(type);
00395 }
00396 
00397 static int pc_getc()
00398 {
00399    int intrpt = 22;                  /* ROM-BIOS call for keyboard read */
00400 
00401    rg.h.al = 0;                  /* Clear input registers   */
00402    rg.h.ah = 0;                  /* and set service to read */
00403 
00404    int86(intrpt, &rg, &rg);
00405 
00406    if(rg.h.al != 0)            /* If low byte is not clear */
00407      return(rg.h.al);          /* then return value        */
00408    else {                           /* else,                    */
00409      switch(rg.h.ah) {         /* check hi byte for code   */
00410        case  3 :
00411                 return(COTL_AT_SIGN);
00412        case 71 :
00413                 return(HOME_KEY);
00414        case 72 :
00415                 return(UP_ARROW);
00416        case 73 :
00417                 return(PGUP_KEY);
00418        case 75 :
00419                 return(LEFT_ARROW);
00420        case 77 :
00421                 return(RIGHT_ARROW);
00422        case 79 :
00423                 return(END_KEY);
00424        case 80 :
00425                 return(DOWN_ARROW);
00426        case 81 :
00427                 return(PGDN_KEY);
00428        case 115 :
00429                 return(COTL_LEFT_ARROW);
00430        case 116 :
00431                 return(COTL_RIGHT_ARROW);
00432        default :
00433                          return(BADKEY);
00434        }
00435    }
00436 }
00437 
00438 static void pc_putc(
00439 int c)
00440 {
00441         rg.h.ah = 14;           /* write char to screen with current attrs */
00442         rg.h.al = (unsigned char) c;
00443         rg.h.bh = 0;
00444         rg.h.bl = 0x07;
00445         int86(0x10, &rg, &rg);
00446 }
00447 
00448 static void pc_move(
00449 int row,
00450 int col)
00451 {
00452         rg.h.ah = 2;            /* set cursor position function code */
00453         rg.h.dl = (unsigned char) col;
00454         rg.h.dh = (unsigned char) row;
00455         rg.h.bh = 0;            /* set screen page number */
00456         int86(0x10, &rg, &rg);
00457 }
00458 
00459 static void pc_eeol()
00460 {
00461         unsigned int attr;      /* attribute byte mask to place in RAM */
00462         unsigned int *lnptr;    /* pointer to the destination line */
00463         int i;
00464         int ccol;       /* current column cursor lives */
00465         int crow;       /*         row  */
00466 
00467         /* find the current cursor position */
00468         rg.h.ah = 3;            /* read cursor position function code */
00469         rg.h.bh = 0;            /* current video page */
00470         int86(0x10, &rg, &rg);
00471         ccol = rg.h.dl;         /* record current column */
00472         crow = rg.h.dh;         /* and row */
00473 
00474         /* build the attribute byte and setup the screen pointer */
00475         attr = 0x0700;
00476         lnptr = &sline[0];
00477         for (i=0; i < term.t_ncol; i++)
00478                 *lnptr++ = SPACE | attr;
00479 
00480         if (dtype == CDCGA) {
00481                 /* wait for vertical retrace to be off */
00482                 while ((inp(0x3da) & 8))
00483                         ;
00484         
00485                 /* and to be back on */
00486                 while ((inp(0x3da) & 8) == 0)
00487                         ;
00488         }                       
00489 
00490         /* and send the string out */
00491         memmove(scptr[crow]+ccol, &sline[0], (term.t_ncol-ccol)*2);
00492 }
00493 
00494 static void pc_eeop()
00495 {
00496         int attr;               /* attribute to fill screen with */
00497 
00498         rg.h.ah = 6;            /* scroll page up function code */
00499         rg.h.al = 0;            /* # lines to scroll (clear it) */
00500         rg.x.cx = 0;            /* upper left corner of scroll */
00501         rg.x.dx = (term.t_nrow << 8) | (term.t_ncol - 1);
00502                                 /* lower right corner of scroll */
00503         attr = 0x07;
00504         rg.h.bh = (unsigned char) attr;
00505         int86(0x10, &rg, &rg);
00506 }
00507 
00508 static void pc_beep()
00509 {
00510         pc_putc(BEL);
00511         ttflush();
00512 }
00513 
00514 #endif
00515 #endif

00518 /* ==========================================================================
00519  *                         Termcap Terminal
00520  * ==========================================================================
00521  */
00522 
00523 #if TERMCAP
00524 
00525 /*
00526  * The routines in this section provide support for terminals supported
00527  * through the UNIX termcap capability.
00528  *
00529  * You need to include the termcap library at link time
00530  * or else most of the calls to t____ functions don't work
00531  */
00532 
00533 #define NROW    24
00534 #define NCOL    80
00535 #define BEL     0x07
00536 #define ESC     0x1B
00537 
00538 #define TCAPSLEN 315
00539 
00540 static char tcapbuf[TCAPSLEN];
00541 static char    /*PC,*/
00542         *CM,
00543         *CE,
00544         /* *UP, */
00545         *CD;
00546 
00547 
00548 globle TERM term = {
00549         NROW-1,
00550         NCOL,
00551         tcapopen,
00552         ttclose,
00553         ttgetc,
00554         ttputc,
00555         ttflush,
00556         tcapmove,
00557         tcapeeol,
00558         tcapeeop,
00559         tcapbeep
00560 };
00561 
00562 static void tcapopen()
00563 {
00564         char *t, *p;
00565         char tcbuf[1024];
00566         char *tv_stype;
00567         char err_str[72];
00568 
00569         if ((tv_stype = getenv("TERM")) == NULL)
00570         {
00571                 puts("Environment variable TERM not defined!");
00572                 exit(1);
00573         }
00574 
00575         if((tgetent(tcbuf, tv_stype)) != 1)
00576         {
00577                 gensprintf(err_str, "Unknown terminal type %s!", tv_stype);
00578                 puts(err_str);
00579                 exit(1);
00580         }
00581 
00582         p = tcapbuf;
00583         t = tgetstr("pc", &p);
00584         if(t)
00585                 PC = *t;
00586 
00587         CD = tgetstr("cd", &p);
00588         CM = tgetstr("cm", &p);
00589         CE = tgetstr("ce", &p);
00590         UP = tgetstr("up", &p);
00591 
00592         if(CD == NULL || CM == NULL || CE == NULL || UP == NULL)
00593         {
00594                 puts("Incomplete termcap entry\n");
00595                 exit(1);
00596         }
00597 
00598         if (p >= &tcapbuf[TCAPSLEN])
00599         {
00600                 puts("Terminal description too big!\n");
00601                 exit(1);
00602         }
00603         ttopen();
00604 }
00605 
00606 static void tcapmove(
00607   int row, 
00608   int col)
00609 {
00610         putpad(tgoto(CM, col, row));
00611 }
00612 
00613 static void tcapeeol()
00614 {
00615         putpad(CE);
00616 }
00617 
00618 static void tcapeeop()
00619 {
00620         putpad(CD);
00621 }
00622 
00623 static void tcapbeep()
00624 {
00625         ttputc(BEL);
00626 }
00627 
00628 static void putpad(
00629    char *str)
00630 {
00631         tputs(str, 1, (int (*)(int)) ttputc);
00632 }
